solution_line_template: If there are {black_bears} black bears in the park and {more_brown_bears} more brown bears than black bears, there are {black_bears}+{more_brown_bears} = <<{black_bears}+{more_brown_bears}={brown_bears}>>{brown_bears} brown bears.
The number of black and brown bears in the park is {brown_bears}+{black_bears} = <<{brown_bears}+{black_bears}={black_and_brown_bears}>>{black_and_brown_bears}
Twice the number of black bears as white bears means {black_bears}/{white_bears_divisor} = <<{black_bears}/{white_bears_divisor}={white_bears}>>{white_bears} white bears.
The population of bears in the national park is {white_bears}+{black_and_brown_bears} = <<{white_bears}+{black_and_brown_bears}={total_bears}>>{total_bears}
